column1: Circumcision is the surgical removal of the foreskin of the penis.
Most commonly, the foreskin is pushed from the head of the penis and clamped with a metal or plastic ring-like device.
This pushes the tissue into a groove in the plastic over the head of the penis.
Tylenol (acetaminophen) may be given afterward.
They recommended that there should be access to this procedure for those families that choose it.

Risks related to circumcision: - Bleeding - Infection - Redness around the surgery site - Injury to the penis Some research has suggested that uncircumcised male infants have an increased risk of certain conditions, including: - Cancer of the penis - Certain sexually transmitted diseases, including HIV - Infections of the penis - Phimosis (tightness of the foreskin that prevents it from retracting) - Urinary tract infections The overall increased risk for these conditions is thought to be relatively small.
